com.googlecode.kevinarpe.papaya.process

Class AbstractProcessSettings

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.googlecode.kevinarpe.papaya.process.AbstractProcessSettings
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Process2, ProcessBuilder2

    @FullyTested
public abstract class AbstractProcessSettings
extends Object
    This is the shared base class for ProcessBuilder2 and Process2.
    Author:
    Kevin Connor ARPE (kevinarpe@gmail.com)

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  AbstractProcessSettings.ChildProcessState
      Used by the copy constructor to distinguish between copies of ProcessBuilder2, where the child process has not started, and Process2, where the child process has started.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractProcessSettings

        protected AbstractProcessSettings()

      • AbstractProcessSettings

        protected AbstractProcessSettings(AbstractProcessSettings other,
                       AbstractProcessSettings.ChildProcessState state)
        Copy constructor.
        Parameters:
        other - reference to another instance of this class, perhaps ProcessBuilder2 or Process
        state -
        • state of child process -- started or not
        • To copy ProcessBuilder2, use AbstractProcessSettings.ChildProcessState.HAS_NOT_STARTED
        • To copy Process2, use AbstractProcessSettings.ChildProcessState.HAS_STARTED
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if other or state is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if state is an unknown value

    • Method Detail

      • childProcessState

        public AbstractProcessSettings.ChildProcessState childProcessState()
        This value is set on construction and never changes.
        Returns:
        state of child process -- started or not
        See Also:
        AbstractProcessSettings.ChildProcessState

      • stdoutSettings

        public ProcessOutputStreamSettings stdoutSettings()
        Settings for STDOUT stream of child process. Initially, settings are controlled from ProcessBuilder2. When the child process is spawned via ProcessBuilder2.start(), the settings are copied by Process2. Most settings remain mutable after the child process starts.
        Returns:
        • reference to settings for STDOUT stream of child process
        • If child process has not started, this is a reference to ProcessOutputStreamSettings
        • If child process has started, this is a reference to ProcessOutputStreamSettingsAfterStart
        See Also:
        stderrSettings(), childProcessState(), ProcessOutputStreamSettings, ProcessOutputStreamSettingsAfterStart

      • stderrSettings

        public ProcessOutputStreamSettings stderrSettings()
        Settings for STDERR stream of child process. Initially, settings are controlled from ProcessBuilder2. When the child process is spawned via ProcessBuilder2.start(), the settings are copied by Process2. Most settings remain mutable after the child process starts.
        Returns:
        • reference to settings for STDERR stream of child process
        • If child process has not started, this is a reference to ProcessOutputStreamSettings
        • If child process has started, this is a reference to ProcessOutputStreamSettingsAfterStart
        See Also:
        stdoutSettings(), childProcessState(), ProcessOutputStreamSettings, ProcessOutputStreamSettingsAfterStart

      • stdinData

        public abstract byte[] stdinData()
        Retrieves an array of bytes to be written to the STDIN stream of the child process.

        Depending upon the implementation, this may or may not create a copy of the byte array. Generally, ProcessBuilder2 will return a reference to the original array to allow modifications, but Process2 will return a copy of the original array.

        Returns:
        array of bytes to write to child process STDIN stream
        See Also:
        stdinDataRef()

      • stdinDataRef

        protected abstract byte[] stdinDataRef()
        Similar to stdinData(), but guarantees the return value is a reference to, not a copy of, the original byte array.
        See Also:
        stdinData()

      • stdinText

        public abstract String stdinText()
        Retrieves a reference to text to be written to STDIN stream of child process.
